title: Medicare / Centrelink scams (rebate, frozen account, QR code tricks)
summary: Scammers pretend to be Services Australia (Medicare/Centrelink) and send links or QR codes to steal your details.
how_it_works: You get a text/email about an unclaimed payment, rebate, or ‘account frozen’.
They provide a link/QR code and ask you to ‘update’ details.
Your info is captured and can be used for identity theft or fraud.
warning_signs: Promises of an unclaimed rebate or threats that your service is suspended.
Link or QR code to ‘update details’.
Asks for personal info you wouldn’t normally enter from a message.
example_hooks: “Your Centrelink account is suspended — update now.”
what_to_do: Don’t use links/QR codes from unexpected messages.
Go through official apps/sites you open yourself.
If you shared details, contact official help lines and your bank if needed.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
